Dialogue:
DL: Good evening, I hope you can assist me.
DK: Thank you for reaching out. How can I help you today?
DL: Do you have any favorite foods, like minkabu?
DK: I don't have a particular favorite, but I enjoy katsudon and had some today.
DL: I love katsudon too! I had it this morning, actually.
DK: Can you really enjoy katsudon in the morning?
DL: Yes, I usually have a big breakfast and a light dinner.
DK: That’s interesting. Have you always done that?
DL: Yes, it's a habit from when I was dieting.
DK: Eating before bed can lead to weight gain, can’t it?
DL: Late-night snacks can be tempting though, don’t you think?
DK: They definitely can be. I used to make instant yakisoba and have a drink late at night.
DL: That sounds like a great combo. Now I feel like snacking.
DK: Recently, I’ve been avoiding alcohol at night for health reasons.
DL: Are you aiming for alcohol-free days to stay healthy?
DK: Yes, I don’t drink daily, and there are more non-alcoholic options now. I only drink with dinner.
DL: I haven't tried non-alcoholic drinks recently. How do they taste?
DK: Domestic non-alcoholic beers have a strong aroma, but low-alcohol Beery is quite good.
DL: Real beer is still the best, don’t you think?
DK: Yes, but I often drink non-alcoholic beer from Germany, available at Gyomu Super. It’s a good alternative.
DL: I shop at Gyomu Super too. They do have a wide selection of alcohol, right?
DK: Yes, I mainly buy alcohol and sweets there. It’s convenient.
DL: Do you have any recommendations?
DK: The exclusive spicy Mala Ikari Beans are quite good.
DL: Thanks, I’ll look for them next time. I usually get squid fries.
DK: Fried squid goes well with beer.
DL: True, now I feel like having a drink.
DK: Those beans are also tempting.
DL: Given the time, we should probably resist.
DK: Agreed, let’s be patient.

DL: Please take care of it.
DE: Yes, please!
DL: Do you have any favorite foods?
DE: Lately, I've been really into the takoyaki from the deli section at the supermarket.
DL: Is it because the octopus pieces are quite large, or is there some other reason you're hooked?
DE: I thought it was dashi. Also, the dough is chewy and very delicious.
DL: A chewy dough with flavorful broth! I want to try it!
DE: There are many takoyaki shops, each with its own delicious flavor, but this takoyaki has a taste that you won't find anywhere else.
DL: Comparing them sounds interesting!
DE: Right. I really think I like takoyaki. What kind of food do you like?
DL: I generally like fried foods quite a bit, but lately I've especially been into tonkatsu.
DE: I see! It's not common to have just tonkatsu, but I often eat katsu sandwiches.
DL: I also like katsu sandwiches! That crispy texture is irresistible!
DE: Do you know a sandwich shop called Märchen?
DL: No, it's the first time I've heard of it. What kind of sandwiches do they have?
DE: There are also cutlet sandwiches, but the fruit-based cream sandwiches are really plentiful.
DL: Cream sandwich! Strawberries or peaches come to mind. Do you have any recommendations?
DE: The ones I ate before were strawberries and mandarins. Also, pineapples and Shine Muscat grapes were delicious.
DL: Shine Muscat! Is that really an ingredient? I want to try it!
DE: I'm sure they also have seasonal limited products, so you can enjoy various flavors every time you go.
DL: What a lovely shop. Do you come here often?
DE: I have the impression that there are stores in large JR stations. I always buy them at Shinagawa when I return home.
DL: I thought it was a single shop, but there are several locations! I’d like to make a purchase there if I get the chance.
DE: I also started wanting to eat!
DL: That's nice. It's like the perfect thing to reward yourself with.
DE: Rewarding yourself is important, isn't it?
DL: That's right! Especially in times like these.
DE: I want to eat lots of delicious food and spend my time with a smile.
DL: I understand. Precisely because times are tough now!
DE: Yes, yes. Food is important!

DL: Good evening. Nice to meet you.
DU: Good evening. How can I help you?
DL: Have you had any pleasant events recently?
DU: I have plans for a weekend camp festival.
DL: A camping festival? Does that mean many people camp at the same location?
DU: Yes, and there will be a music festival as well.
DL: Will there be various artists performing?
DU: Yes, including reggae artists. It's my first festival.
DL: Sounds interesting. Camping by day and music by night.
DU: Yes, you can enjoy music and shopping all day, then sleep in a tent at night.
DL: I've never been camping. Do you camp often?
DU: I started late last year, so I'm still new to it.
DL: What made you interested in camping?
DU: My husband wanted to, and seeing friends do it got me interested.
DL: How was it when you tried it? Did you enjoy it more than expected?
DU: Yes, I really got into it. Now I want more gear.
DL: What gear are you looking for now?
DU: A tent, but I already have three, so it's a dilemma.
DL: Three tents? Do you use them for different purposes?
DU: Yes, based on appearance and size.
DL: So, you have different tents for different uses?
DU: Yes, initially it was practical, but now I like the variety.
DL: It sounds like an engaging hobby.
DU: It can be a bit troublesome.
DL: Are tents expensive?
DU: It varies. I started with a pop-up tent under 20,000 yen.
DL: Are there more expensive ones?
DU: Yes, over 100,000 yen, which is too much for me.
DL: It seems like an extensive hobby.
DU: One-touch tents are spacious and fit 4-5 people. Goodbye.

DL: Good evening.  
DY: Good evening. How can I help you today?  
DL: Have you taken an interest in anything recently?  
DY: Recently, I've been hooked on games.  
DL: A game? Is it a console game or a mobile game?  
DY: I play exclusively on the Switch, not mobile games.  
DL: I sometimes play on the Switch too. Which games do you play?  
DY: I mainly play Splatoon.  
DL: Oh, Splatoon! I've heard it's entertaining. Do you play it frequently?  
DY: Yes, I'm quite active in it. There's a new release next week that I'm really excited about.  
DL: Ah, right. Splatoon 3 is coming out soon, correct? Have you pre-ordered it?  
DY: Yes, Splatoon 3 will be out soon, and I've pre-ordered it.  
DL: That's great! I've heard online matches can be very competitive. Is it hard for beginners?  
DY: The system matches you with players of similar skill.  
DL: I see. So, it adjusts based on your ability. I was interested but felt a bit hesitant.  
DY: Initially, controlling the game might be challenging, but you'll get used to it.  
DL: I understand. It sounds like it's worth trying.  
DY: Correct. Starting with Splatoon 3 would be a good choice.  
DL: Is there a trial version available? I'd like to get a feel for the game.  
DY: The trial version was available last Sunday, but it’s no longer accessible.  
DL: Oh, I missed that.  
DY: Yes, it was free for 12 hours only.  
DL: Did you get a chance to play it?  
DY: Yes, I played for about 2 hours.  
DL: How was it? Did it look promising?  
DY: It was extremely enjoyable! I’m looking forward to the full release.  
DL: Your enthusiasm is contagious! That's awesome!  
DY: It's probably the game I've been most passionate about.  
DL: I'll have to try it once a demo version is available again. Now I'm looking forward to the release too.  
DY: Yes, please do try it when the trial version is available again!

DL: Good evening. Please assist me.  
CB: Good evening. How can I help you?  
DL: Have you been into anything lately?  
CB: I have been watching dramas and YouTube.  
DL: I watch YouTube too. What genres do you prefer?  
CB: Recently, I've been watching videos by Yusuke Narita and Hiroyuki.  
DL: I'm not familiar with them. What kind of content do they produce?  
CB: They cover a variety of topics, including economics and other subjects.  
DL: So, they discuss a range of topics beyond just economics?  
CB: Yes, they offer insights on many different subjects.  
DL: Interesting. I find face-to-face conversations challenging. How about you?  
CB: I am comfortable in one-on-one interactions but not in large groups.  
DL: Same here. I get nervous and flustered.  
CB: How do you handle communication at work?  
DL: I work with the same colleagues in each department, so it’s pretty friendly. It was tough initially, though.  
CB: Stressful human relationships can be challenging.  
DL: How is it at your workplace?  
CB: I manage three jobs, and each one offers a change of pace.  
DL: Three jobs? Don’t you get confused?  
CB: It's manageable for now.  
DL: What kind of work do you do?  
CB: I work as a caregiver, in a home office, and at a call center.  
DL: That's a diverse range. Were you always interested in these fields?  
CB: I was working full-time from home, but due to a reduction in work, I took up part-time jobs.  
DL: Was the reduction due to COVID-19?  
CB: The decrease in work wasn't related to COVID-19.  
DL: I see. COVID-19 did affect my workplace a bit.  
CB: What kind of work do you do?  
DL: I work in the manufacturing industry. We had issues with material supply.  
CB: The import business must have been impacted by COVID-19.

DL: Good evening. Can you assist me?
CB: Good evening. How can I help you today?
DL: Have you had dinner?
CB: Yes, I had curry udon.
DL: Curry udon! What's your favorite food?
CB: Curry.
DL: Do you make it yourself?
CB: Yes, various kinds.
DL: Do you start with spices? Is it different from store-bought?
CB: Yes, you can customize the taste.
DL: What made you start cooking with spices?
CB: I like Indian curry.
DL: Have you eaten at Indian restaurants or traveled there?
CB: I’ve visited Bangladesh and Thailand.
DL: Do you travel often? Are the flavors different?
CB: Yes, they vary.
DL: Have you ever disliked food in another country?
CB: No, I haven’t traveled much. What about you?
DL: I haven't traveled overseas. It makes me anxious.
CB: Understandable. Traveling alone can be challenging.
DL: Were you ever scared traveling alone?
CB: I was more energetic when younger.
DL: What was your first trip like?
CB: There were some delays, but I enjoyed it.
DL: Did you learn the local language for your trip?
CB: I used a conversation book.
DL: Did that help?
CB: Yes, I had an interpreter.
DL: That must have been helpful.
CB: Yes, it facilitated communication.

DL: Good evening.
CB: Good evening. How can I assist you today?
DL: Do you read books or manga often?
CB: Yes, I read mostly on Line Manga.
DL: Have you read anything interesting recently?
CB: I re-read Glass Mask.
DL: That's a classic. Curious to see how it ends.
CB: Uncertain if it will be finished soon.
DL: Long series can be unpredictable.
CB: The author seems to be taking a long break.
DL: Considering their age, we can only wait. Any other manga recommendations?
CB: Dr. Stone is interesting.
DL: The one with Doihy, right? It's funny.
CB: Yes, it's interesting. Do you have any recommendations?
DL: A shogi manga like March Comes in Like a Lion. The art is cute.
CB: I'll consider reading it.
DL: Please do. It's enjoyable even without knowing shogi. Do you read printed books? What genres?
CB: Business books and fortune-telling materials.
DL: What kind of fortune-telling? Birth months or palm reading?
CB: I know palm lines and astrology.
DL: Are your predictions often accurate?
CB: They can be.
DL: Understood.
CB: Some enjoy it, others don't.
DL: It can reveal unknown aspects of oneself.
CB: It's about different perspectives.
DL: I like astrology websites too.
CB: With some study, you can learn a lot.
DL: I'll consider studying it.
CB: It's worthwhile.

DL: Good evening. I appreciate your assistance.
DK: Good evening. How can I assist you today?
DL: Have you read any manga recently?
DK: Yes, I recently read "The Fable."
DL: Was it interesting?
DK: Yes, it was quite engaging.
DL: Should I give it a try despite the art style?
DK: What types of manga do you usually enjoy?
DL: I enjoy a variety, including JoJo.
DK: JoJo is popular. The Fable has its own unique appeal. Do you have a current favorite?
DL: Yes, "The Last Restaurant."
DK: I haven't read that one, but "The Fable" was recommended to me and I enjoyed it.
DL: Is it worth overlooking the art style for the story?
DK: Yes, the story is compelling. You might also enjoy Kaiji.
DL: I like Kaiji too, although the art took some getting used to.
DK: The author's other works like "Ten" and "Silver and Gold" are also good.
DL: Which one should I start with?
DK: "Silver and Gold" would be a good start.
DL: I'll read that. I've read Hanchou and Tonegawa.
DK: Those are great spin-offs.
DL: Yes, they are quite entertaining.
DK: Reading the main story first adds to the experience.
DL: It's confusing when people mix up spin-offs with the main story.
DK: Yes, it can be.
DL: Reading order is indeed important.
DK: Absolutely.
DL: I'll start with "Silver and Gold." I'm excited to read it!
DK: I also recommend "Nemurubaka."
DL: I've read that, by the author of Sore Machi.
DK: Yes, it's highly regarded.

DL: Good evening.
DK: Good evening.
DL: Have you had dinner yet?
DK: No, not yet.
DL: What are you planning to eat?
DK: Goya Champuru.
DL: Is someone at home preparing it?
DK: Yes, my mother.
DL: Is it being cooked right now?
DK: Likely, but I'm not sure.
DL: Do you like goya champuru?
DK: Yes, I love it. Do you enjoy it as well?
DL: Yes, though the preparation can be tedious.
DK: The school version wasn’t the same.
DL: Was it different in school lunches?
DK: Yes, it was watery and sweet without the bitterness.
DL: That sounds very different.
DK: My mother's version pairs well with rice.
DL: I can't imagine it being sweet.
DK: School lunches also had curry and mapo tofu.
DL: Mapo tofu too? Was that common?
DK: Yes. What was popular in your time?
DL: Curry or hashed beef, things that go well with rice.
DK: Did you have fried bread?
DL: Yes, with sugar. Do they have soybean flour now?
DK: Possibly. How old are you?
DL: Nearly 40.
DK: Did you have lunch competitions?
DL: Boys did that a lot. Is it still common?
DK: Yes, timing it to make someone quit is still common.

DL: Good evening.
DE: Good evening. How can I assist you today?
DL: Do you read manga or anything like that?
DE: I sometimes read manga. How can I help with your manga-related query?
DL: What kind of things have you read recently?
DE: I haven't bought any new ones, but I have read Tokyo Ghoul.
DL: I read it too! Did you read it till the end?
DE: I have a general understanding of the contents.
DL: I quite like this work. I think the battle descriptions are good.
DE: The kagune designs are varied, which is appealing.
DL: I'd like to watch the anime too, but I haven't been able to yet. Hopefully, there will be a sequel.
DE: The original anime might be sufficient. I haven't seen Re, but it appears to be different.
DL: Is the Re version of lower quality than the original, or is it a content issue?
DE: The story development is very fast.
DL: Do you mean you wanted a more detailed description?
DE: The combat depiction wasn't well received from the beginning.
DL: I see. Although Muji and Re seem similar, there appears to be quite a difference between them.
DE: It's like asking for ramen and being served instant noodles.
DL: That would certainly be disappointing.
DE: I haven't looked at it thoroughly.
DL: That's helpful. Do you have any recommended anime?
DE: Re:Zero and Overlord are recommended.
DL: I'm reading Re:Zero as a manga. The protagonist is really passionate.
DE: Did you reach the sanctuary arc?
DL: Since I prefer paperback books, that's about where I am.
DE: The latest is now the Empire arc.
DL: Have they progressed significantly from the sanctuary? It seems difficult to catch up on the novels from now on.
DE: If you read it online quickly, you'll be fine.
DL: I'll check it out.
DE: Understood.
